p: In conifers, four class I members have been described to date in several spruce and pine species, which were designated KN1 to KN4 [ 112, 113, 114, 115]. More recently, two members from class II subfamily were isolated in Pinus pinaster and other coniferous species, which were designated KN5 and KN6 [ 111, 115]. Studies of their expression by RT-qPCR and in situ mRNA hybridization in plantlets ( Figure 3), together with analyses of their overexpression in the heterologous system Arabidopsis thaliana, support that the functional differentiation established in angiosperms might be evolutionarily conserved between gymnosperms and angiosperms to a great extent [ 115] (see Supplementary Figure S2). Function and/or expression domains of KNOX genes from different coniferous species and their Arabidopsis thaliana counterparts are summarized in Table 2 at the end of this section.
